entries.title: Why everyone's talking about 'nepo babies'
entries.description: One of the surest roads to success in showbiz is to be the child of an already famous and successful person.

entries.title: Antarctica's iconic penguins are at risk of disappearing
entries.description: It was only a matter of time before human-caused climate change and pollution reached even the most isolated continent on the planet. As global temperature rises, Antarctica's pristine landscape is already changing, and new research shows most of the region's plant and animal species -- including its iconic penguins -- are in trouble.

entries.title: Winter storm sweeps across the country as Biden urges Americans to take it 'extremely seriously'
Biden urges Americans to take massive winter storm 'extremely seriously'
US believes Wagner mercenary group took delivery of North Korean arms
'This storm means business': CNN meteorologist on dangerously low temps
entries.description: CNN meteorologist Derek Van Dam reports on dangerously low temperatures from the arctic blast affecting much of the US ahead of the holiday weekend.

entries.title: Russian citizens are now crowdfunding equipment for troops
entries.description: Schoolchildren raise money for socks, mothers buy winter clothes and sleeping bags, community groups collect donations for body armor.

entries.title: Cassidy Hutchinson told Jan. 6 committee she felt pressure from Trump allies not to talk
entries.description: The final straw for former Trump White House aide Cassidy Hutchinson with her first attorney, paid through allies of former President Donald Trump, came when he told her to stop cooperating with the January 6 select House committee even if risked a contempt of Congress charge, transcripts of her interviews and sources familiar with her testimony tell CNN.

entries.title: See some of the record-shattering temperature drops
entries.description: The major winter storm crossing the nation is causing dramatic declines in temperatures across the central US as arctic air pushes south and east.

entries.title: Ukrainians react to Zelensky's historic visit to Washington DC
entries.description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky's speech at the US Capitol on Wednesday, where he expressed gratitude for US support, was a historic moment, and one which resonated with people in his home country.

entries.title: Shania Twain talks body positivity and posing topless for single cover
entries.description: Shania Twain is 57 years old and proud of her body.

entries.title: Flu, Covid-19 and RSV: Tracking hospitalizations this brutal virus season
entries.description: A tough respiratory virus season is underway in the United States, as influenza and the respiratory syncytial virus came early and hit hard this year, straining the nation's health care system and driving up hospitalizations to rates not seen in years — even as Covid-19 continues spreading across the country.

entries.title: For many LGBTQ Americans, Christmas highlights the importance of chosen family
entries.description: A version of this story appeared in CNN's Race Deconstructed newsletter.

entries.title: 5 famous music copyright cases
entries.description: Music is supposed to sooth the savage beast, but it can also get some people riled up.

entries.title: Jamie Lee Curtis pays tribute to mom Janet Leigh
entries.description: Legendary actress Janet Leigh passed away in 2004, but her daughter, fellow actress Jamie Lee Curtis, remains proud of her late mother.

entries.title: Men to compete in Olympic Artistic Swimming for first time at Paris 2024
entries.description: Male athletes will be allowed to compete in Olympic Artistic Swimming events for the first time at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games, the aquatic sports' global governing body FINA said on Thursday.

entries.title: Accused NYC subway shooter intends to plead guilty to terrorism charges, according to court documents
entries.description: The man accused of shooting passengers at random on a Brooklyn subway in April intends to plead guilty to terrorism charges, according to court documents.

entries.title: India on alert for new variants as Covid wave sweeps China
America needs immigrants to solve its labor shortage
entries.description: Immigration has long been a political football in the United States. But If you're wondering why America's labor shortage persists nearly three years into the Covid pandemic, it's in part because America doesn't have enough immigrants.

entries.title: Suspended Washington, DC, police officers found guilty in death of 20-year-old man during police pursuit
entries.description: Two suspended Washington, DC, officers have been found guilty on charges related to the death of a 20-year-old man during a 2020 police pursuit, the US Attorney's Office for the District of Columbia said in a news release Wednesday.

entries.title: Police plead with suspected kidnapper to return 5-month-old who was in stolen car
entries.description: A search for a 5-month-old boy is entering a fourth day Thursday, with Columbus, Ohio, investigators continuing to plead with his suspected kidnapper to return the child.

entries.title: Dolly Parton has both a secret song and the secret to being married for 56 years
entries.description: You may have to wait for 23 years to hear this new Dolly Parton track.

entries.title: Temperatures drop as low as -59F as major winter storm sweeps across US
entries.description: A major Arctic blast is plunging temperatures to dangerous levels in much of the country and a developing "bomb cyclone" is set to unload heavy snow and blizzard conditions especially in the Midwest on Thursday and Friday -- a combination making for a perilous few days leading to Christmas.

entries.title: Retired major fears Russia retaliation. Here's why
entries.description: Ret. US Army Major Mike Lyons discusses how he fears Russia could react if Congress concedes to Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky's request for more military support.

entries.title: 'Once in a generation' arctic blast threatens holiday travel
entries.description: CNN's Pete Muntean reports on widespread travel woes across the US as the holiday season travel is impacted by a "bomb cyclone."

entries.title: Records contradict Santos' claim grandparents fled Holocaust
entries.description: Incoming congressman-elect George Santos claims his grandparents fled the Holocaust. These claims are being contradicted by genealogy records. CNN's Jason Carroll reports.

entries.title: Arizona to remove makeshift border wall as part of a lawsuit, court filing says
entries.description: Arizona agreed to remove shipping containers placed as a makeshift wall along its shared border with Mexico as part of an ongoing lawsuit, according to a Wednesday court filing.

entries.title: Super Bowl winner Ronnie Hillman dies aged 31 after cancer battle
entries.description: Ronnie Hillman, a Super Bowl-winning running back for the Denver Broncos, passed away aged 31 on Wednesday, according to a post from his family on his Instagram page.

entries.title: Kremlin denounces US arms supplies for Ukraine
entries.description: Kyiv and its Western allies are "set for a long confrontation with Russia" following President Volodymyr Zelensky's momentous visit to Washington, Moscow said as the war in Ukraine approaches 10 months.

entries.title: Researchers make important progress toward a possible universal flu vaccine
entries.description: Influenza is continuing its early and severe rampage through the United States, but there's some hopeful news for flu seasons of the future.

entries.title: Washington moved fast to crack down on TikTok but has made little progress with Big Tech
entries.description: In a matter of days, the United States is expected to ban federal employees from downloading or using TikTok on government-issued phones or tablets, marking the country's broadest crackdown on the short-form video app to date.

entries.title: Astronauts embark on spacewalk after space debris triggered one-day delay
entries.description: The International Space Station is set to receive its second solar power boost in a month during a spacewalk on Thursday. The event will come after a piece of wayward space garbage interfered with plans to carry out the spacewalk Wednesday.

entries.title: Meet the signing Santa who makes Christmas special for deaf children
entries.description: He's making a list. He's checking it twice. He's giving the gift of holiday cheer to deaf and hard of hearing children. Meet Santa Charles, one the few of the deaf professional Santas who communicates solely in American Sign Language.

entries.title: Argentine tattooists swamped by demand for Messi tributes
entries.description: Since Argentina's World Cup win turned Buenos Aires into a massive street party, tattoo artists have been hard at work inking the image of Lionel Messi on the bodies of fans paying tribute to the man who has come to rival the legend of the country's other soccer god, Diego Maradona.

entries.title: Brooklyn Nets score franchise record 91 points in first half during blowout win over Golden State
entries.description: The Brooklyn Nets put up a franchise record 91 points in the first half -- the third highest total in NBA history -- in Wednesday's 143-113 blowout win over reigning champion the Golden State Warriors.

entries.title: Jennifer McClellan is poised to make history in Virginia after winning Democratic nomination to succeed late Rep. Donald McEachin
entries.description: Jennifer McClellan has won the Democratic nomination for Virginia's 4th Congressional District in the special election to succeed the late Rep. Donald McEachin, the commonwealth's Democratic Party announced early Thursday morning in a news release, putting her in prime position to become the first Black woman to represent the Old Dominion in Congress.

entries.title: Zelensky seizes moment before GOP controls House
entries.description: Fresh from a trip to the bloody front lines in Ukraine, President Volodymyr Zelensky strode onto the ornate US House floor on Wednesday evening in his signature green military wear to shore up his supply line.

entries.title: India on alert for new variants as Covid wave sweeps China
entries.description: India's health minister has advised the public to take precautions against Covid-19, including getting vaccinated and wearing masks, as the country remains on alert for potential new variants that could emerge from the wave of infections sweeping neighboring China.

entries.title: With 25 million players worldwide, padel is only tipped to get 'bigger and bigger' by tennis star Andy Murray
entries.description: It's believed to be a sport that started with a siesta.

entries.title: How virtual clothes could help solve fashion's waste problem
entries.description: Fashion's ephemeral nature might seem an odd bedfellow for the blockchain, an online ledger that's designed to be permanent. But the industry is finding ways to harness it and other digital tools to reduce waste and push fashion into the future.

entries.title: How Covid-hit China is coping with its drugs shortage
entries.description: • Video: CNN visits Beijing crematorium to get the truth behind China's Covid numbers

entries.title: Why the world needs African wildlife filmmakers
entries.description: I am an African living in Nairobi, Kenya, who makes films about my continent's wildlife. But as a species, wildlife filmmakers from Africa are rarer than mountain gorillas. This needs to change.

entries.title: 'What was their sacrifice for?': Devastation for female Afghan students stripped of education
entries.description: The 21-year-old student had been studying hard for weeks as she prepared for the final exams of her first year of university. She was almost done, with just two exams left, when she heard the news: the Taliban government was suspending university education for all female students in Afghanistan.

entries.title: Pelé's health has worsened, hospital says
entries.description: Pelé's health has worsened and the Brazilian soccer great now requires greater care due to the progression of his cancer, according to a statement by the Albert Einstein Jewish Hospital in São Paulo on Wednesday.

entries.title: Italy's Traore calls out team mates over 'offensive' Christmas present
entries.description: A Black Italian rugby player accused his team mates of racism on Wednesday after they gave him a "rotten banana" during a 'Secret Santa' anonymous gift exchange.

entries.title: Zelensky's grit and defiance epitomizes the nation he leads
entries.description: If ever a leader personified their nation, it is Volodymyr Zelensky.

entries.title: Why this French ski resort banned smoking
entries.description: A red and white banning sign on top of a black burning cigarette -- the universal non-smoking symbol -- will be the new addition welcoming ski enthusiasts from around the world in the small village of Les Gets in the French Alps this month.

entries.title: Trump seeks to toss E. Jean Carroll sexual assault lawsuit
entries.description: Former President Donald Trump asked a federal court on Wednesday to dismiss the sexual assault lawsuit, brought under a new state law in New York, that was filed by the ex-magazine columnist who has accused Trump of rape.

entries.title: In historic speech to US Congress, Ukrainian president urged lawmakers to strengthen sanctions against Russia and 'let the terrorists be held responsible for aggression'
Zelensky: Ukraine will never surrender
Watch Zelensky's historic speech to Congress
entries.description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky delivered a historic speech from the United States Capitol, expressing gratitude for American support in fighting Russian aggression since the war began -- and asking for more.

entries.title: Opinion: Zelensky's powerful message to Putin
entries.description: Members of the United States Congress, Republicans and Democrats, rose to their feet time and again Wednesday night, nearly drowning out Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky in one emotional standing ovation after another. It was an extraordinary evening, concluding an extraordinary day during a crucial moment in history.

entries.title: 'A lot of it's bluster': Retired general reacts to Putin's latest threat
entries.description: Lt. Gen. Mark Hertling (Ret.) says that Vladimir Putin's latest threat that Russia will be increasing troop deployments is "probably a lot of bluster" and says Russian soldiers in the field have lost confidence in their leadership.

entries.title: 2 executives associated with Sam Bankman-Fried of FTX plead guilty to multiple criminal charges
entries.description: Two senior executives associated with collapsed crypto exchange FTX have pleaded guilty to multiple criminal charges and are cooperating with federal prosecutors, according to unsealed court records.

entries.title: US border officials watch migrants use rafts to cross into US
entries.description: Days before Title 42 was set to end, the Supreme Court is stepping in after an emergency appeal filed by a group of Republican-led states. The justices' decision will affect cities along the US-Mexico border and dictate the future of the thousands of migrants waiting to get into the US. CNN's Rosa Flores reports.

entries.title: First transcripts from Jan. 6 committee reveal key witnesses refusing to testify
entries.description: The House select committee investigating the January 6, 2021, insurrection released more than 30 witness interview transcripts Wednesday from key figures who aided former President Donald Trump's efforts to overturn the 2020 election, including the likes of conservative attorney John Eastman and one-time national security adviser Michael Flynn.

entries.title: Hillary Clinton reacts to Zelensky's speech
entries.description: CNN's Anderson Cooper talks to Hillary Clinton about Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky's address to US Congress.

entries.title: 'This is Vladimir Putin's worst nightmare': Tapper reacts to Zelensky's speech
entries.description: CNN's Jake Tapper and Jim Sciutto react to Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky's speech to the US Congress where he was received with enthusiastic applause.

entries.title: 9-year-old daughter dishes embarrassing facts about NBC show host
entries.description: NBC's Jenna Bush Hager had some embarrassing moments on "TODAY with Hoda and Jenna" after her 9-year-old daughter revealed some personal secrets.

entries.title: President Zelensky addresses members of Congress
Watch US Congress erupt in applause when Zelensky arrives
entries.description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky was greeted by loud applause from members of Congress before delivering his address at the US Capitol.

entries.title: John Oliver discovers trash bins that talk 'sexily' and uses them for 'demon' dolls
entries.description: John Oliver and his team got permission to reprogram sexy trash cans in Sweden to help dispose of weird "demon" dolls they collected earlier this year.
